subject: Personal Finance
title: The Time Value of Money
description: A quick, practical guide to The Time Value of Money.

hook.text: Would you rather have $1,000 today or $1,000 in five years? Today, obviously. That insight drives all finance.

buildup.text: Money today is worth more than the same amount later because you can invest it and earn returns.

discovery.text: $1,000 invested at 7% becomes $1,403 in five years. Waiting costs you $403 in potential gains.

twist.text: This is why inflation hurts. It reduces the future purchasing power of money you hold today.

climax.text: Retirement planning, loan decisions, and business valuations all depend on the time value of money.

punchline.text: A dollar today beats a dollar tomorrow.

quiz.question: Why is money today worth more than the same amount in the future?
options: Because it can be invested to earn returns now
Because banks pay higher rates on old money
